I would speculate no further than it was just part of his diguise.  By the same token, I wouldn't be surprised if he was quite handy with two swords (though not as suave as Aoshi --- TWO kodachi in ONE sheath??? <snicker> one of my favorite quotes from RK). Do we really have any idea just how many different styles Saitou was schooled in?  And given how slick RK Saitou is, I'd expect him to be ambidextrous (he certainly was against Sano in their little fist fight... at least twice it was a right upper-cut that knocked Sano silly.)
 
phil

Tiffany <tnamwong@...> wrote:
okay, further speculation...this mystery guy uses 2 swords.
I just read an article on left handed people and how many gain a high
level of ambidexterity depending on the social environment they lived
in...now I will always insist that hist. Saitou was a natural lefty
and acquired "social" ambidexterity...in the case of handing things to
people/writing in front of other (you usually hand things to people
with both hands or right hand at least in Japanese culture - I
heard)...and many martial artists, e.g. bare-handed techniques will
purposefully try to gain ambidexterity helpful in
grappling/throws/pins etc...so it is possible Saitou could use 2
swords very well.
